meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm outside can daunt my little sister.
meanings.sent2: The dark forest at night can daunt even the bravest of adventurers.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse tried to daunt the big cat by puffing up its fur.
meanings.sent4: The towering mountain peaks daunt the climbers with their sheer size.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strict demeanor can daunt some students from asking questions.

meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to lose courage or confidence.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected failure can daunt even the most determined individuals.
meanings.sent2: The constant criticism began to daunt her enthusiasm for painting.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tried to daunt the grumpy old dog with its energy.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds daunt the sun, making it hide behind them.
meanings.sent5: The challenging puzzle can daunt those who are not patient enough to solve it.
